code: @Manual{,   title = {nasa: Access National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Open APIs for Space and Earth Data},   author = {Steph Buongiorno},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.0}, }

what: Access National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Open APIs for Space and Earth Data
title: Access National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Open APIs for Space and Earth Data
text: Access National Aeronautics Space Administration (NASA) Open APIs Space Earth Data. nasa package provides functions access download data various NASA APIs, including: - Astronomy Picture Day (APOD): https://api.nasa.gov/planetary/apod - Mars Rover Photos: https://api.nasa.gov/mars-photos/api/v1/rovers - Earth Polychromatic Imaging Camera (EPIC): https://api.nasa.gov/EPIC/api/natural - Near Earth Object Web Service (NeoWs): https://api.nasa.gov/neo/rest/v1/neo/browse - Earth Observatory Natural Event Tracker (EONET): https://eonet.gsfc.nasa.gov/api/v3/events - NASA Earthdata Common Metadata Repository (CMR): https://cmr.earthdata.nasa.gov/search/collections.json retrieved data returned cleaned, tidy data frames suitable analysis visualization.

title: Access National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Open APIs for Space and Earth Data
text: functions package can run using default DEMO_KEY. However, DEMO_KEY publicly shared subject rate limits, strongly recommended request API key NASA. can quickly obtain personal key visiting https://api.nasa.gov/.

title: Access National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Open APIs for Space and Earth Data
text: Currently, install local files GitHub (future release):

title: Access National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Open APIs for Space and Earth Data
text: install.packages("devtools")

title: Access National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Open APIs for Space and Earth Data
text: devtools::install_github("yourusername/nasa")

title: Access National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Open APIs for Space and Earth Data
text: get_apod_metadata(start_date, end_date, api_key = "DEMO_KEY", folder_name = NULL) - Queries APOD retrieve image metadata two dates. - returns results media type image. - Optionally saves images folder Desktop. get_mars_rover_photos_and_metadata(rover, earth_date, api_key = "DEMO_KEY", folder_name = NULL) - Retrieves photos taken Mars rover specific Earth date. - Valid rover names: “curiosity”, “opportunity”, “spirit”, “perseverance”. - Optionally saves photos folder Desktop. get_earthdata(keyword, n_results, start_date = NULL, end_date = NULL) - Searches NASA Earthdata CMR database datasets matching keyword. - Can optionally filter results temporal range. - Returns cleaned data frame dataset metadata.

title: Access National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Open APIs for Space and Earth Data
text: library(nasa)

what: Get Astronomy Picture of the Day metadata
title: Access National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Open APIs for Space and Earth Data
Access National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Open APIs for Space and Earth Data

what: Search Earthdata for “sea surface temperature” (or any keyword or phrase)
title: Access National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Open APIs for Space and Earth Data
code: earthdata_results <- get_earthdata(   keyword = "sea surface temperature",   n_results = 10)

what: Retrieve Astronomy Picture of the Day (APOD) images and metadata — get_apod_metadata
title: Retrieve Astronomy Picture of the Day (APOD) images and metadata — get_apod_metadata
text: Queries NASA's Astronomy Picture Day (APOD) API retrieve images metadata specified start end date. image media types included.

title: Retrieve Astronomy Picture of the Day (APOD) images and metadata — get_apod_metadata
code: get_apod_metadata(   start_date,   end_date,   api_key = "DEMO_KEY",   folder_name = NULL )

title: Retrieve Astronomy Picture of the Day (APOD) images and metadata — get_apod_metadata
text: start_date Character. Start date query "YYYY-MM-DD" format. end_date Character. End date query "YYYY-MM-DD" format. api_key Character. NASA API key. Defaults "DEMO_KEY", personal API key recommended. folder_name Character NULL. Folder name save images Desktop provided. NULL, images printed saved.

title: Retrieve Astronomy Picture of the Day (APOD) images and metadata — get_apod_metadata
text: data frame containing metadata APOD images (date, title, explanation, URL, media type).

title: Retrieve Astronomy Picture of the Day (APOD) images and metadata — get_apod_metadata
text: function filters media types images (e.g., videos). prints image along truncated explanation entry, returns full metadata data frame.

title: Retrieve Astronomy Picture of the Day (APOD) images and metadata — get_apod_metadata
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Retrieve APOD images for a date range apod_metadata <- get_apod_metadata(   start_date = "2024-04-01",   end_date = "2024-04-02",   api_key = "DEMO_KEY" ) } # }

what: Search NASA Earthdata Collections Metadata — get_earthdata
title: Search NASA Earthdata Collections Metadata — get_earthdata
text: Queries NASA's Common Metadata Repository (CMR) search Earth science datasets related specified keyword. Optionally filters results temporal range.

title: Search NASA Earthdata Collections Metadata — get_earthdata
code: get_earthdata(keyword, n_results, start_date = NULL, end_date = NULL)

title: Search NASA Earthdata Collections Metadata — get_earthdata
text: keyword Character. search term phrase used find relevant datasets titles, descriptions, keywords, provider names. n_results Integer. number dataset entries retrieve. 2000, multiple pages requested automatically. start_date Character NULL. Optional start date filter "YYYY-MM-DD" format. provided, must used end_date. end_date Character NULL. Optional end date filter "YYYY-MM-DD" format. provided, must used start_date.

title: Search NASA Earthdata Collections Metadata — get_earthdata
text: data frame containing metadata matching datasets, cleaned column names (columns '.' '$' removed).

title: Search NASA Earthdata Collections Metadata — get_earthdata
text: CMR Earthdata’s search engine — backend database stores metadata : Satellite datasets Earth science data (climate, ocean, atmosphere, land) Observational granules (single files like images, temperature readings, etc.) Services (subsetting, reformatting, data services) search finds matches based keyword provided. keyword can appear : Dataset titles Dataset descriptions Dataset keywords (tags) provider names function accesses CMR API endpoint https://cmr.earthdata.nasa.gov/search/collections.json. harmonizes columns across API pages returns number requested results. results found, empty data frame returned.

title: Search NASA Earthdata Collections Metadata — get_earthdata
code: # Search for 10 datasets related to sea surface temperature results <- get_earthdata(keyword = "sea surface temperature", n_results = 10)  # Search with a temporal constraint results_time <- get_earthdata(   keyword = "sea surface temperature",   n_results = 10,   start_date = "2020-01-01",   end_date = "2020-01-02" )

what: Retrieve and Save EPIC Natural Color Earth Images — get_epic_earth_images
title: Retrieve and Save EPIC Natural Color Earth Images — get_epic_earth_images
text: Queries NASA's EPIC (Earth Polychromatic Imaging Camera) API retrieve metadata images Earth taken specified date. Images can optionally saved folder user's Desktop.

title: Retrieve and Save EPIC Natural Color Earth Images — get_epic_earth_images
Retrieve and Save EPIC Natural Color Earth Images — get_epic_earth_images
text: date Character NULL. Earth date "YYYY-MM-DD" format retrieve images . NULL, today's date used. Note today's images may yet available. api_key Character. NASA API key. Defaults "DEMO_KEY", personal API key recommended. folder_name Character NULL. provided, images saved folder name user's Desktop. NULL, images displayed saved.

title: Retrieve and Save EPIC Natural Color Earth Images — get_epic_earth_images
text: data frame containing metadata retrieved EPIC images, including image names, dates, captions.

title: Retrieve and Save EPIC Natural Color Earth Images — get_epic_earth_images
text: function builds download URLs based NASA's EPIC archive structure, organizes images year/month/day subfolders. natural color images retrieved. Images displayed using magick package can optionally saved PNG files.

title: Retrieve and Save EPIC Natural Color Earth Images — get_epic_earth_images
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Retrieve and view EPIC images from April 1, 2024 epic_data <- get_epic_earth_images(date = "2024-04-01", api_key = "your_actual_api_key")  # Retrieve and save EPIC images to Desktop/EPIC_Images epic_data_saved <- get_epic_earth_images(   date = "2024-04-01",   api_key = "DEMO_KEY",   folder_name = "EPIC_Images" ) } # }

what: Retrieve and Save Mars Rover Photos — get_mars_rover_photos_and_metadata
title: Retrieve and Save Mars Rover Photos — get_mars_rover_photos_and_metadata
text: Queries NASA's Mars Rover Photos API retrieve photos taken specified rover given Earth date. Optionally saves images folder user's Desktop.

title: Retrieve and Save Mars Rover Photos — get_mars_rover_photos_and_metadata
code: get_mars_rover_photos_and_metadata(   rover,   earth_date,   api_key = "DEMO_KEY",   folder_name = NULL )

title: Retrieve and Save Mars Rover Photos — get_mars_rover_photos_and_metadata
text: rover Character. name Mars rover. Must one : "curiosity", "opportunity", "spirit", "perseverance". Default "curiosity". earth_date Character. Earth date query "YYYY-MM-DD" format. Default "2024-04-01". api_key Character. NASA API key. Defaults "DEMO_KEY", personal API key recommended. folder_name Character NULL. provided, images saved folder name user's Desktop. NULL, images displayed saved.

title: Retrieve and Save Mars Rover Photos — get_mars_rover_photos_and_metadata
text: data frame containing metadata retrieved photos, including photo ID, sol (Martian day), camera name, image source URL, Earth date, rover name.

title: Retrieve and Save Mars Rover Photos — get_mars_rover_photos_and_metadata
text: function prints retrieved image associated metadata console. folder name specified, images saved Desktop inside given folder. images taken specified date returned; images exist, function stops error.

title: Retrieve and Save Mars Rover Photos — get_mars_rover_photos_and_metadata
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Retrieve and save photos taken by Curiosity on June 3, 2015 mars_photos_metadata <- get_mars_rover_photos_and_metadata(   rover = "curiosity",   earth_date = "2015-06-03",   api_key = "DEMO_KEY",   folder_name = "MarsPhotos" ) } # }

what: Retrieve Near-Earth Objects (Asteroids) Within a Date Range — get_neo_feed
title: Retrieve Near-Earth Objects (Asteroids) Within a Date Range — get_neo_feed
text: Queries NASA's Near Earth Object Web Service (NeoWs) retrieve data asteroids comets approaching Earth within specified date range.

title: Retrieve Near-Earth Objects (Asteroids) Within a Date Range — get_neo_feed
Retrieve Near-Earth Objects (Asteroids) Within a Date Range — get_neo_feed
text: start_date Character. start date asteroid data "YYYY-MM-DD" format. end_date Character NULL. end date "YYYY-MM-DD" format. NULL, defaults 7 days start_date. api_key Character. NASA API key. Defaults "DEMO_KEY", personal API key recommended.

title: Retrieve Near-Earth Objects (Asteroids) Within a Date Range — get_neo_feed
text: data frame containing information near-Earth objects, including name, close approach date, relative velocity (km/h), miss distance (kilometers), estimated diameter (meters).

title: Retrieve Near-Earth Objects (Asteroids) Within a Date Range — get_neo_feed
text: function calls NeoWs feed endpoint https://api.nasa.gov/neo/rest/v1/feed. asteroid's metadata extracted tidy format analysis. maximum allowed range start end dates 7 days.

title: Retrieve Near-Earth Objects (Asteroids) Within a Date Range — get_neo_feed
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Retrieve asteroid data for a 5-day period neo_data <- get_neo_feed(   start_date = "2024-04-01",   end_date = "2024-04-05",   api_key = "DEMO_KEY" ) } # }
